subject: Re: [junit] Philosophical question--Multiple assertions in one test case
msgSnippet: ... Agreed.  The less asserts the better but stop trying as soon as it starts feeling unnatural. Also, I noticed that the number of asserts tended to grow as I
messageBody:
On 12/8/06, Stephen Smith <steve@...> wrote:
>
> This question comes up time and again on this mailing list. For what
> it's worth, I think the idea of having a single assertion per test case
> is a noble design aim, but it can be tough.


Agreed. The less asserts the better but stop trying as soon as it starts
feeling unnatural.

Also, I noticed that the number of asserts tended to grow as I move from
unit tests to functional tests, which is not very surprising since
functional tests usually have much more complex exit criteria than unit
tests.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
